sentence.Network_en: Everyone has days when they feel dejected or down.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个人都有沮丧失意或情绪低落的时候。

sentence.Network_en: She looked so dejected when she lost the game.
sentence.Network_cn: 她输掉比赛时情绪显得非常低落。

sentence.Network_en: A man used to vicissitudes is not easily dejected.

entry.def: If you are dejected, you feel miserable or unhappy, especially because you have just been disappointed by something.

example.ex: Everyone has days when they feel dejected or down.
example.tran: 每个人都有沮丧失意或情绪低落的时候。

means.word_mean: 1. affected or marked by low spirits;

sentences.sentence: "is dejected but trying to look cheerful"

auth_sentence.content: Now it was Murray cutting a dejected figure.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now it was Murray cutting a dejected figure.

auth_sentence.content: His manner still continued dejected and depressed.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: His manner still continued dejected and depressed.

auth_sentence.content: For the rest of the game, Ha sat on the bench, dejected.

sentences.en: A man used to vicissitudes is not easily dejected.
Peter was dejected,his confidence in tatters.
sentences.cn: 彼得精神沮丧,信心皆无。

sentences.en: She looked very dejected when she was told that she hadn’t got the job.
sentences.cn: 当她被告知没有获得那份工作时,神情相当沮丧。
